page_content:
View Edit - Instrument Set Up

Version:MissionOS_2.0

The View/Edit feature of an instrument allows users to view or modify certain instrument details existing in the application.

The View/Edit page of an instrument normally (dependent on individual portal specifics) has the following tabs:

  • Instrument Set Up (Definition)
  • Instrument Calibration
  • Calculated Calibrations
  • Review Setup
  • Readings
  • Review History
  • Edit History

 

To access the View/Edit – Edit History page, perform the following steps:

  1. Once you log into the application, go to Instrument Data section in the Homepage.
  2. Select the instrument required.
  3. Click View or edit instrument. (small bar chart symbol above graph thumbnail) You reach the View/Edit page where the Instrument Set Up is open by default.
  4. Alternatively, click Data Manager from the Homepage of the portal (bar chart symbol top right). Select Instrumentation > Data > View/Edit.

 

The Instrument Set Up tab is open by default.

The Instrument Set Up interface displays the basic details of a particular instrument.

 

 

This page also contains the following functionalities:

  • Edit
  • Model
  • Graph
  • PDF
  • CSV
  • Delete Instrument
  1. Click Edit to modify the instrument setup details. Click Save to save the updated information. (Refer to figure 3)
  2. Click Model. The Model page of the same instrument subtype opens in another tab.
  3. Click Graph. A popup opens with graphical representation of the instrument readings. (Refer to figure 4)
  4. Click PDF. It opens in another tab as PDF report.
  5. Click CSV. CSV file of the instrument downloads. (Refer to figure 5)
  6. Click Delete Instrument to delete instrument details.

 

 

 

 

The source of the Setup information in View/Edit page depends on the setup file upload in the Load Data Files interface as seen below:
